name: archaeologically
content:

in a way that relates to archaeology (= the study of past history by digging to find old buildings, tools, objects, etc.): The site of the house has never been archaeologically excavated. Salvagers who found the shipwreck did not use archaeologically sound methods. See
archaeological
More examplesFewer examplesAn archaeologically significant burial ground was found during excavation at the construction site.The decision to build on a site so archaeologically rich was severely criticized. Archaeologically, this Maya household consisted of several distinct sites.Perishable materials such as wood and unfired clay are rarely preserved archaeologically.
